data.title: Color Picker: hex color format settings
data.body:
Currently, Color Picker can only output colors in uppercase 6-digit format. This may be in conflict with linting rules for a project.
I think this should be configurable through settings:
- uppercase/lowercase;
- short/long format for colors like `#ccc`.

data.title: Thanks for destroying Emmet
data.body:
I can understand that there is few people that found your "new invention" great but for most of us those changes broke workflow that we were accustomed to for years.

I really like TAB expanding, and fact that old emmet was working with blade templates and vue without issues. 
Right now I dropped VSC  as it cause me more headache than helping with do my work fast.

Can we switch new emmet off and go back to something that really work?

data.title: Workspace folder paths should be relative to workspace file location
data.body:
When you save a workspace file, the path to each folder is currently absolute.

Working in a team where it has practical value to check the workspace file into source control, that won't work.

So when the workspace is saved to a file, each folder path should be converted to a relative path.

data.title: Java syntax highlighting breaks on quote-parentheses combo
data.body:
Version: 1.14.2, Linux

The following line `IGNORE_SPACE(8, "ignore spaces before '('")`, seen inside enum declaration breaks highlighting, while being a perfectly valid Java.

data.title: paste indentation starting 1.15
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:06.988Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
githistory|don|0.2.3
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
autoimport|ste|1.2.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. copy the following from a template html
    <input 
      mdInput
      name='mdSelectedDate0'
      [ngModel]='mdSelectedDate0'
      [mdDatepicker]="picker0"
    >

2. paste it
    <input 
      mdInput
      name='mdSelectedDate0'
      [ngModel]='mdSelectedDate0'
      [mdDatepicker]="picker0"
    >
    <input 
    mdInput
    name='mdSelectedDate0'
    [ngModel]='mdSelectedDate0'
    [mdDatepicker]="picker0"
  >

3. Code 1.15 really doesn't like my style of indentation, which indents all the attributes of a tag and close it with the closing > (because unfortunately <input> cannot be closed by </input> or />

Code aligns the attributes (mdInput etc) with the <input, and outdates the closing ">". If pasted several times, the indentation will be shallower and shallower.

4. Pressing Undo will revert the change in indentation, back to what happens after a normal paste.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

Yes, it is reproduced without extensions.

BTW, I suggest moving this question to the top. If it is not reproducible after disabling, that means I would have typed a lot of stuff to explain in futile.

data.title: MacOS keyboard shortcuts don't (all) apply when File Open/Save dialog is presented
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:06:21.685Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-dash|dee|1.7.0
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7
vscode-npm-dependency|how|1.1.4
svg|joc|0.0.9
docthis|joe|0.4.7
Go|luk|0.6.63
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
stylelint|shi|0.28.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Do something to cause the standard Mac 'Save As' sheet to open (e.g. create a new file and go to File->Save As
2. Use a standard shortcut combination (standard in the context of the OS, not VSCode), such as cmd-A to select all text in the 'Save As:' field, or Ctrl-Tab to switch focus to the file list.
3. These expected actions don't occur for these specific examples, and presumably others as well, because they are still handled by the app (hence the flash of the relevant menu item when the aforementioned examples are used.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Removes the expression that returns 'red' as a color if the 'string' parameter is not set
data.body:
Removes the expression that returns 'red' as a color if the 'string' parameter is not set.

I was using a theme that is compiled from a .yml file to a .json file. The issue was that if I had a variable whose value was not set in the .yml file, the generated .json file would contain a null value. Looking through the source code, I found the method `fromHex` that would return `Color.red` if if the parameter passed to it couldn't be resolved.

data.title: Disable features of an extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: My [Docker Explorer](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.docker-explorer) has 5 Explorer Views. Some users complain about some views are not used in their scenarios: https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-docker-explorer/issues/22. In v1.15 of VS Code, it is able to remove the views from existing windows. But every time we open up a new folder in a separate window, all the views still show up. When user do this, could we make this behavior permanent to hide certain view instead of a temporary setting? Thanks a lot!

data.title: [Misconfiguration?] Control + Tab in OSX displays popup, not switching

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (f1a3bc4f714123eaff5e15ad976d7f403cc1bfa2, 2017-08-11T05:08:07.764Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0 (macOS Sierra)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open 2+ files
2. Hit Control + Tab

A few releases ago Control + Tab used to work pretty well. Now I'm trying to fast-switch between some files and a stupid popup appears. I mean, okay, well, you guys added a popup... but without focus! so I can't even use my arrow keys to choose the file (like in ST). This misbehavior (it wasn't working like this a few releases ago...) disrupts my current workflow and it is an unexpected change. 

There's nothing in the settings either to restore the default behavior. Please stop playing around with hotkeys :(

Is there any way to fix this? Thanks!

`less code:`

`.loop-bg(@n, @i: 1) when (@i =< @n) {

        .list@{i} {

`

data.title: ExtensionContext.storagePath is empty if no workspace is open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (0b6da14128b4e61e331193f18786e8db2792a643, 2017-08-11T19:14:29.146Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-azurelogin|chr|0.0.1
---

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a hello world typescript extension using 'yo code' (as described [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-hello-world))
2. Set a breakpoint in extension.ts activate() 
3. F5 the extension
4. In the new instance of VS, make sure *no* workspace is open
5. Active the extension by opening the command pallet and selecting the 'Hello World' command

Expected: When you hit the breakpoint, context.storagePath has a value
Actual: context.storagePath is 'undefined'

NOTE: This does *not* reproduce if you have a workspace open and I believe it was introduced with this change https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/73dad2ebb9ee82fd40d358fbdf39e1403ced342e?diff=unified#diff-c61682f360a18cf690ac59fe3f625db7L133 @bpasero

data.title: Provide an API to get list of user's auto-detected and configured tasks
data.body:
Use case:

In an extension, I want to show users an explorer view of all their tasks. Currently this is being done by manually crawling the project for task files. Since Tasks 2.0 already does the work of auto-detecting for certain task systems, I want to take advantage of that. 

Additionally, for example, if the C++ extension contributes a task provider that we don't detect out of the box, I don't want to recreate that in my own extension.

data.title: Search on searched results.
data.body:
feature-request
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version: all
- Languages: all

1. I want to search a phrase only in the files that contains the results of the last search.
2. Then the searched result is more specific.

Steps to Reproduce:

Example:
file1.css:
//THE HOUSES ARE RED 

file2.php:
//THE HOUSE IS BLACK AND WHITE 

file3.py:
//THE CAR IS BLACK

file4.js:
//THE HOUSE IS WHITE AND THE CAR IS YELLOW

I'm looking for a file that contains the phrases: "THE HOUSE", "WHITE", "BLACK".

Search 1 "THE HOUSE": results: file1.css, file2.php, file4.js
Search 2 in the last files: "WHITE" results: file2.php, file4.js
Search 3 in the last files: "BLACK" result: file2.php

Thank you.
